did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Virginia Equal Rights Amendment Ratification Council papers, 1970-1982

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Equal Rights Amendment Ratification Council. Papers, 1970-1982. Accession 31486. Organization records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Deposited by the Virginia Equal Rights Amendment Ratification Council, Richmond, April-September 1982.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Virginia Equal Rights Ratification Council was a coalition of more than thirty organizations in Virginia that supported the Equal Rights Amendment to the U.S. Constitution. Included were education, legal, labor, press, political, and religious groups, and groups comprised primarily of women.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1970-1982, encompassing a comprehensive history of the Equal Rights Amendment, emphasizing the efforts for its passage in Virginia. Includes correspondence, subject files, newspaper clippings, mailing lists, printed material, posters, maps, monaural and video cassette tapes, and ephemera. Material relating to the General Assembly from 1979-1981 concern its actions regarding the Equal Rights Amendment as well as background information on members of the General Assembly during this period. The activities and forms of support for the Equal Rights Amendment by participating organizations are noted, and there are files on the variety of issues which originated as a result of the proposed amendment.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

did.unittitle: Sponsor: House- House of Delegates Information, 1981.
Officials- State-wide and U.S. Congressional elected.
General Assembly Sponsors- important history information.
Privilege and Election Committee and miscellaneous.
House District 36, Chesterfield and Colonial Heights.
National Association of Business and Professional Women's Clubs.
Virginia Commission on the Status of Women.
Women's Clubs, General Federation of; Virginia Federation.
National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP).
Directory of Virginia Chambers of Commerce, statewide.
Amalgamated Meat cutters and Butcher Workers of North America.
Bakery and Confectionary Workers International Union of America.
American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (empty).
International Union of Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers, Local 172.
American Women in Radio and Television.
Council on Women and the Church.

Good Shepherd's Catholics for Shared Responsibility.
Commission on Status and Role of Women (UMC).
United Presbyterian Church USA; Albert Currie Winn.
Coalitions, Fairfax County Democratic Women's Caucus.
Coalitions, Valley Citizens for the ERA.
Series VII: Equal Rights Amendment, General information, 1978-1981.
ERA in other states, New Mexico.

Unratified States ERA Coalitions, South Carolina.
Series VIII: Equal Rights Amendment, Issues, 1972-1980.
